name.paramonov.doomep.shogi

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • name.paramonov.doomep.shogi.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmptyPiece, PromotablePiece, UnpromotablePiece

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    A Class representing a piece in a game of shogi. This class defines the basic requirements for a piece:
    • Has a given location.
    • Has an allegiance to a side.
    • Is promoted.
    • Is located on the board or on in the drop table.
    All pieces extend this class, and implement different rules of checking for valid moves and promotion.

    • Field Detail

      • x

        protected int x
        The x-value of this piece on the game board. Will be in a range from 0 to 8.

      • y

        protected int y
        The y-value of this piece on the game board. Will be in a range from 0 to 8.

      • allegiance

        protected int allegiance
        This piece's allegiance. Equivalent to a piece's color in chess. The side that this piece belongs to. Possible values are:
        • 1: "White" (Bottom side).
        • 0: "Mercenary" (Neutral).
        • -1: "Black" (Top side).
        Mercenary pieces can be captured by either side, and then dropped. They do not move, and cannot attack any pieces.

      • pieceName

        protected java.lang.String pieceName
        Name of this piece. Implemented in each subclass individually. Used to find out the name of the piece and to differentiate them.

      • doubleCharRepresentation

        protected java.lang.String[] doubleCharRepresentation
        This piece's 2 character representation. Used for Text-based IO. Stored as an array with 1 value for each possible allegiance.

      • checkmatable

        protected boolean checkmatable
        Whether this piece can be checkmated. Used for verification in check.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Piece

        public Piece(int x,
     int y,
     int allegiance)
        Constructs a piece at a given x and y-value, with the given allegiance.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-value at which this piece is located.
        y - The y-value at which this piece is located.
        allegiance - The allegiance of this piece.

    • Method Detail

      • generateMoves

        public boolean[][] generateMoves(GameState state)
        Generates all possible moves for this piece. Used to see which tiles it can go to, and returns an array of all possible (x, y)-value pairs where this piece can move.
        Parameters:
        state - The current state of the game at the time of verification.
        Returns:
        The possible locations where this piece can move.

      • isValidMove

        protected abstract boolean isValidMove(GameState state,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Returns whether a move can be undertaken by this Piece. Each piece has different rules, so this one is to be implemented individually.
        Parameters:
        state - The current state of the game at the time of verification.
        x - The x-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        y - The y-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        Returns:
        Whether this Piece can move to the given x and y values.

      • isUncheckedMove

        protected boolean isUncheckedMove(GameState state,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Returns whether a move can be undertaken by this Piece without verifying for check. Used in order to prevent King check feedback.
        Parameters:
        state - The current state of the game at the time of verification.
        x - The x-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        y - The y-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        Returns:
        Whether this Piece can move to the given x and y values.

      • move

        protected GameState move(GameState state,
             int x,
             int y)
        Moves the piece, and captures any pieces at the target tile. Verifies if target tile is a valid move, and then moves the piece to that location. If the target tile is occupied by an enemy tile, it is captured, demoted, and placed in the drop table.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        y - The y-value to which this piece is trying to move.
        state - The state of the game before the piece is moved.
        Returns:
        The state of the game after the piece is moved.

      • isPromotable

        protected abstract boolean isPromotable()
        Verifies whether this piece can be promoted. This is placed here so that calling .getPromotable() can be done on any piece, which allows us to find out exactly which pieces can be promoted. If it was implemented in a different class, that would cause trouble if we were to verify for any piece.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the piece can be promoted.

      • promote

        protected abstract Piece promote()
        Returns the piece this piece is promoted to. Each piece promotes to a different piece, and therefore is implemented individually in each subclass.
        Returns:
        The piece this piece promotes to.

      • demote

        protected abstract Piece demote()
        Returns the piece this piece is demoted from. Each piece demotes to a different piece, and therefore is implemented individually in each subclass. This method is mostly used only in capturing, as you cannot demote normally.
        Returns:
        The piece this piece demotes to.

      • setPosition

        protected void setPosition(int x,
               int y)
        Sets this piece's x and y-values to certain values.
        Parameters:
        x - The value to which the x-value is to be set.
        y - The value to which the y-value is to be set.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns this piece's x-value.
        Returns:
        This piece's x location on the board.

      • setX

        protected void setX(int x)
        Sets the x-value of this piece to be a certain value.
        Parameters:
        x - The value to which this x-value is to be set.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Returns this piece's y-value.
        Returns:
        This piece's y location on the board.

      • setY

        protected void setY(int y)
        Sets the y-value of this piece to be a certain value.
        Parameters:
        y - The value to which this y-value is to be set.

      • getAllegiance

        public int getAllegiance()
        Returns this piece's allegiance. Possible values are:
        • 1: "White" (Bottom side).
        • 0: "Mercenary" (Neutral).
        • -1: "Black" (Top side).
        Mercenary pieces can be captured by either side, and then dropped. They do not move, and cannot attack any pieces.
        Returns:
        The value of this piece's allegiance.

      • setAllegiance

        protected int setAllegiance(int allegiance)
        Sets this piece's allegiance. Use for capturing pieces. Possible values listed above. Method has a return in order to double-check whether the setting worked flawlessly.
        Parameters:
        allegiance - The value to which this piece's allegiance is to be set to.
        Returns:
        The new value of this piece's allegiance.

      • getDoubleCharRepresentation

        public java.lang.String getDoubleCharRepresentation()
        Returns this piece's 2 character code. Used for ASCII IO.
        Returns:
        This piece's 2 character representation;

      • getCheckmatable

        public boolean getCheckmatable()
